caption.text: Mass distribution of available bone tissue samples expressed as total weight (wt) in grams. The percentages of dark and light coloured samples, as well as the rest are shown and expressed as wt%.

statement.text: L11 of sample label (1Ai2)5 has highest total weight of 120.63.
L4 of sample label 03 has the highest Rest (<2mm) (wt%) of 40.4.

caption.text:
Details of the samples/hearths used in this study. Cultural attribution (see ) MG: Middle Gravettian; EG: Early Gravettian; EVA: Evolved Aurignacian; EA: Early Aurignacian. Hearth labels, locations and characteristics are from , except hearth a in Level 4, directly sampled from existing section by . COM: charred organic material; Bone: heated bone tissue; Fill (jar nr): material < 200 µm preserved in jars with specific identification numbers, jars are archived at the Abri Pataud Museum; Not known or not available: “
-
”; Present: “X”; LM: Laurent Marquer; Mov: Movius.

statement.text: L5 and L11 has samples by LM.

For the analyses three randomly selected specimens of each of the eleven samples were embedded in a separate resin block and polished in accordance with standard methods as defined in ISO 7404, part 2 ( 1985 ).

caption.text:
Results of analyses based on charred organic material (COM). %Ro: Mean reflectance values. Temperatures based on %Ro are according to calibration curves for alkaline conditions ( ). Temperatures based on FTIR are from . No result = -
.

statement.text: There are 6 different types of level in the given table.
The lowest %Ro SD is 0.095.

caption.text: pH measurements on sediment and fill samples, including limestone fragments from the Abri Pataud.

statement.text: sediment and Fill, jar 6 is measured at level 4.
Only level 4 sediment has 8.2 pH value.
Fill, jar 6 and Fill, jar 4 has same pH value.
Sediment level 2 has highest pH value.
Fill, jar 6 and Fill, jar 4 has different pH value.
Limestone and sediment has less pH value.

caption.text: Results of analyses performed on bone tissue samples and the resulting temperature estimates. Temperature reconstructions (in °C) were made using modern reference data ( ; van Hoesel et al., 2019) and based on best fit with the majority of the analytical techniques, taking the observed effects of high pH into account. * = missing values due to measurement error.

statement.text: The highest heating temp. is that ~900.
The lowest XRD CI is 0.01.
The FTIR type are A,K.
The highest heating temp. is that ~100.
The highest XRF Ca wt% 0.64.
This is further supported by the TGA results, which show that some of the organic carbon is still present.

caption.text: Ancient mammalian families identified by their DNA in sediment samples collected from fireplaces at Abri Pataud. Layers, glass jar number and hearth labels are indicated, but for one sample from Layer 5 (“adjacent area”), from the Layer 5 matrix.

statement.text: The highest jar number is #35 for L11.
The hearth label of L5 layer is W-2.
Three of the samples also contained ancient hominin mtDNA
